canonical_explanation.text: Symmetry means a balanced and proportionate arrangement. A figure has line symmetry if it can be folded along a line so that the two halves match exactly. A regular polygon with n sides has n lines of symmetry. A figure has rotational symmetry if it looks the same after rotation by an angle less than 360 degrees. The order of rotational symmetry is the number of times a figure matches itself during a full 360-degree rotation.
rules: Line of symmetry: divides a figure into two mirror-image halves
A regular polygon with n sides has n lines of symmetry
Order of rotational symmetry = number of positions where figure looks the same in 360 degrees
Angle of rotation = 360 / order of rotational symmetry
Every figure with line symmetry has at least order 1 rotational symmetry
A figure may have rotational symmetry without having line symmetry (e.g., parallelogram)

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a square have?
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 4 lines of symmetry: 2 diagonals and 2 lines through midpoints of opposite sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square (regular 4-sided polygon) has 4 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does an equilateral triangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry, one from each vertex to the midpoint of the opposite side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular triangle with 3 sides = 3 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a circle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has infinitely many lines of symmetry â€” every diameter is a line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Every diameter of a circle is a line of symmetry, so there are infinitely many.

questions.question_text: A regular hexagon has ___ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A regular hexagon has 6 sides, so it has 6 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular polygon with n sides has n lines of symmetry. Hexagon: n=6.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a scalene triangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle has no lines of symmetry because all sides and angles are different.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No equal sides or angles means no lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a rectangle (non-square) have?
questions.explanation_correct: A non-square rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry: one horizontal and one vertical through the center.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry (through midpoints of opposite sides).

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does an isosceles triangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles triangle has exactly 1 line of symmetry, from the vertex angle to the midpoint of the base.
questions.explanation_incorrect: One axis of symmetry through the vertex angle.

questions.question_text: What is the order of rotational symmetry of a square?
questions.explanation_correct: A square looks the same after rotations of 90, 180, 270, and 360 degrees. Order = 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square matches itself 4 times in 360 degrees.

questions.question_text: What is the angle of rotation for an equilateral triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: Order = 3. Angle = 360/3 = 120 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 360 / 3 = 120 degrees.

questions.question_text: The order of rotational symmetry of a regular pentagon is:
questions.explanation_correct: A regular pentagon has order 5 rotational symmetry. Angle = 360/5 = 72 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular pentagon: order = 5.

questions.question_text: The order of rotational symmetry of a circle is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A circle looks the same after any rotation, so its order of rotational symmetry is infinite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle matches itself at every angle of rotation.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram (non-rectangle) has rotational symmetry of order 2.
questions.explanation_correct: A parallelogram looks the same after a 180-degree rotation. Order = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rotating 180 degrees maps a parallelogram to itself. Order = 2.

questions.question_text: Which of the following letters has exactly 2 lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: H has 2 lines of symmetry: one horizontal and one vertical.
questions.explanation_incorrect: H has both a vertical and horizontal line of symmetry = 2 lines.

questions.question_text: Which letter has exactly 1 line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter A has 1 vertical line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A has only a vertical line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: The letter S has rotational symmetry of order:
questions.explanation_correct: S looks the same after a 180-degree rotation. Order = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rotating S by 180 degrees gives the same shape. Order = 2.

questions.question_text: Which figure has line symmetry but NOT rotational symmetry of order 2 or more?
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles triangle has 1 line of symmetry but its rotational symmetry order is only 1 (no match before 360 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Isosceles triangle: 1 line of symmetry, rotational order = 1 (only at full 360-degree rotation).

questions.question_text: Which figure has rotational symmetry but NO line symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A non-rectangle parallelogram has rotational symmetry of order 2 but no lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A parallelogram has order 2 rotational symmetry but 0 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a regular octagon have?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular octagon (8 sides) has 8 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular n-gon has n lines of symmetry. Octagon: 8.

questions.question_text: What is the angle of rotation for a regular hexagon?
questions.explanation_correct: Order = 6. Angle = 360/6 = 60 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 360 / 6 = 60 degrees.

questions.question_text: Every regular polygon has both line symmetry and rotational symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: Every regular polygon has n lines of symmetry and rotational symmetry of order n.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular polygons have both types of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A rhombus has:
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus has 2 lines of symmetry along its diagonals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rhombus has 2 lines of symmetry: its two diagonals.

questions.question_text: A regular polygon has rotational symmetry of order 10. How many sides does it have?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular polygon with n sides has rotational symmetry of order n. Order 10 means 10 sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Order = number of sides for regular polygons. Order 10 = 10 sides.

questions.question_text: Which of these shapes has exactly 5 lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: Regular pentagon has 5 sides = 5 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular pentagon: 5 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: If the angle of rotation of a figure is 45 degrees, its order of rotational symmetry is:
A figure has 3 lines of symmetry and rotational symmetry of order 3. It could be:
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry and rotational order 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Equilateral triangle: 3 lines, order 3.

questions.question_text: The letter X has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: X has 2 lines of symmetry: one vertical and one horizontal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: X has 2 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A figure with rotational symmetry of order 6 matches itself every ___ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: Angle = 360/6 = 60 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 360 / 6 = 60 degrees.

questions.question_text: A kite has:
questions.explanation_correct: A kite has 1 line of symmetry along the diagonal connecting the vertices of the unequal angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A kite has 1 line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Which quadrilateral has rotational symmetry of order 2 but no line symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A parallelogram (non-rectangle, non-rhombus) has order 2 rotational symmetry but no lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A general parallelogram has rotational order 2 but 0 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: The order of rotational symmetry of the letter N is:
questions.explanation_correct: N looks the same after a 180-degree rotation. Order = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: N maps to itself at 180 degrees. Order = 2.

questions.question_text: A regular polygon always has at least one line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A regular polygon with n sides has n lines of symmetry (at least 3, since a polygon has at least 3 sides).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular polygons always have lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a semicircle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A semicircle has exactly 1 line of symmetry: the perpendicular bisector of its diameter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: One line of symmetry through the center, perpendicular to the diameter.

questions.question_text: What is the order of rotational symmetry of a regular triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular (equilateral) triangle has rotational symmetry of order 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Equilateral triangle: order = 3.

questions.question_text: An arrow shape (pointing right) has:

options.text: 1 line of symmetry, no rotational symmetry

questions.explanation_correct: An arrow has 1 line of symmetry (horizontal, through the middle) but no rotational symmetry (order 1 only).
questions.explanation_incorrect: An arrow has 1 horizontal line of symmetry but rotational order is only 1.

questions.question_text: Which of these letters has NO line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: F has no line of symmetry. A has vertical, T has vertical, V has vertical.
questions.explanation_incorrect: F cannot be folded along any line to produce matching halves.

questions.question_text: The order of rotational symmetry of a rectangle (non-square) is:
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle matches itself after 180 and 360 degree rotations. Order = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rectangle: matches at 180 and 360 degrees. Order = 2.

questions.question_text: A fan with 4 identical blades has:

options.text: 4 lines of symmetry and order 4 rotational symmetry
0 lines of symmetry and order 4 rotational symmetry
4 lines of symmetry and order 2 rotational symmetry
2 lines of symmetry and order 4 rotational symmetry

questions.explanation_correct: If the blades are curved/angled, there are no lines of symmetry, but the fan has order 4 rotational symmetry (matches every 90 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Curved blades give rotational symmetry but no line symmetry.

questions.question_text: A regular polygon with 12 sides has ___ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: Regular 12-gon has 12 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: n sides = n lines of symmetry. 12 sides = 12 lines.

questions.question_text: The angle of rotation for a figure with order 12 rotational symmetry is:
questions.explanation_correct: Angle = 360/12 = 30 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 360 / 12 = 30 degrees.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does the digit 8 have?
questions.explanation_correct: The digit 8 has 2 lines of symmetry: one vertical and one horizontal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8 has both vertical and horizontal symmetry = 2 lines.

questions.question_text: A regular heptagon (7 sides) has rotational symmetry of order:
questions.explanation_correct: Regular heptagon: order = 7. Angle = 360/7 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular polygon with 7 sides: order = 7.

questions.question_text: If a figure has rotational symmetry of order 4, it must have 4 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: Not necessarily. A figure can have rotational symmetry without having the same number of lines of symmetry. However, some figures (like a square) do have both.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rotational symmetry doesn't guarantee the same number of lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A trapezium (non-isosceles) has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A general (non-isosceles) trapezium has no lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only an isosceles trapezium has 1 line. A general trapezium has 0.

questions.question_text: An isosceles trapezium has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles trapezium has 1 line of symmetry: the perpendicular bisector of the parallel sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1 line through the midpoints of the parallel sides.

questions.question_text: What is the order of rotational symmetry of a rhombus?
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus matches itself after 180 and 360 degree rotations. Order = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rhombus: matches at 180 degrees. Order = 2.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry AND what is the rotational order of a regular pentagon?
questions.explanation_correct: Regular pentagon: 5 lines of symmetry and rotational order 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Regular pentagon: 5 lines, order 5.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does the letter O have?
questions.explanation_correct: If O is considered a perfect circle, it has infinitely many lines of symmetry. If considered an oval, it has 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circular O has infinite lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Every figure has rotational symmetry of order at least:
questions.explanation_correct: Every figure matches itself after a 360-degree rotation, so the minimum order is 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A 360-degree rotation always maps a figure to itself. Minimum order = 1.

questions.question_text: A shape has 4 lines of symmetry and rotational order 4. It could be a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 4 lines of symmetry and rotational symmetry of order 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square fits: 4 lines of symmetry, rotational order 4.

questions.question_text: The English letter Z has:
questions.explanation_correct: Z has no lines of symmetry but has rotational symmetry of order 2 (looks the same after 180-degree rotation).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Z has 0 lines of symmetry but order 2 rotational symmetry.
